article.title: Testing Metal Poor Stellar Models and Isochrones with HST Parallaxes of Metal Poor Stars

choices: The relationship between the mass and luminosity of the stars.
The distribution of stars in the Milky Way.
The location of metal-poor stars in a color-absolute magnitude diagram.
The evolution of stars over time.

multiple_choice_question.text: What information does Table 4 provide about the parallax stars?
choices: Their distance from Earth, temperature, and chemical composition.
Their age, mass, and spectral type.
Their position in the sky, proper motion, and parallax.

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the main conclusion that can be drawn from Figure 3?
choices: The ISO-P isochrones provide a better fit to the HST magnitudes than the ISO-VC isochrones.
The ISO-VC isochrones provide a better fit to the HST magnitudes than the ISO-P isochrones.
There is no significant difference in the fit quality between the ISO-P and ISO-VC isochrones.
The fit quality of both isochrone sets is poor.

multiple_choice_question.text: Why are the RGB colors of NGC 5024 and NGC 6101 inconsistent when using the Harris (1996) reddening values?
choices: The metallicities of the two clusters are significantly different.
The Harris reddening values are likely incorrect for one or both clusters.
The distance to one or both clusters is incorrectly determined.
The two clusters are at different stages of evolution.
